question.title: Add duplicate value content along with the original vaue
question.body:
I have the following code where I'm printing what I'm storing in the rowInfo array :

public class DuplicateTesting {

    public static void main(String[] args) {

        List<String> fileContents = new ArrayList<String>();

        fileContents.add("AB1011");
        fileContents.add("AB1012");
        fileContents.add("AB1012");
        fileContents.add("AB1013");
        fileContents.add("AB1014");
        fileContents.add("AB1015");
        fileContents.add("AB1015");
        ;
        String[] sample_letter = { "A1", "E2", "G1", "C3", "B1", "F2", "H1", "D3", "C1", "G2", "A2", "E3", "D1", "H2",
                "B2", "F3", "E1", "A3", "C2", "G3", "F1", "B3", "D2", "H3", "A4", "E5", "G4", "C6", "B4", "F5", "H4",
                "D6", "C4", "G5", "A5", "E6", "D4", "H5", "B5", "F6", "E4", "A6", "C5", "G6", "F4", "B6", "D5", "H6",
                "A7", "E8", "G7", "C9", "B7", "F8", "H7", "D9", "C7", "G8", "A8", "E9", "D7", "H8", "B8", "F9", "E7",
                "A9", "C8", "G9", "F7", "B9", "D8", "H9", "A10", "E11", "G10", "C12", "B10", "F11", "H10", "D12", "C10",
                "G11", "A11", "E12", "D10", "H11", "B11", "F12", "E10", "A12", "C11", "G12", "F10", "B12", "D11",
                "H12" };
        // Set<String> findDuplicates = new HashSet<String>();
        List<String[]> rows = new ArrayList<String[]>();

        // Store duplicate indexes in an array list
        List<Integer> duplicateIndexes = new ArrayList<Integer>();

        for (int j = 0; j < fileContents.size(); j++) {
            for (int k = j + 1; k < fileContents.size(); k++) {
                if (fileContents.get(k) == fileContents.get(j)) {
                    System.out.println("Duplicates exists");
                    System.out.println("Index: " + k);
                    duplicateIndexes.add(k);
                }
            }
        }

        for (int i = 0; i < fileContents.size(); i++) {

            String replicate = "";
            replicate = duplicateIndexes.contains(i) ? "2" : "";
            String[] rowInfo = { fileContents.get(i) + "_" + sample_letter[i], replicate, sample_letter[i] };
            System.out.println("Adding: " + fileContents.get(i) + "_" + sample_letter[i] + "  | " + replicate + " | "
                    + sample_letter[i]);
            rows.add(rowInfo);

        }

    }

}

Above code prints the following (Duplicates exist):

Index: 2
Duplicates exists
Index: 6
Adding: AB1011_A1  |   | A1
Adding: AB1012_E2  |   | E2
Adding: AB1012_G1  | 2 | G1
Adding: AB1013_C3  |   | C3
Adding: AB1014_B1  |   | B1
Adding: AB1015_F2  |   | F2
Adding: AB1015_H1  | 2 | H1

I want the Adding: part to come out like this (basically display the next duplicate value along side with the original duplicate value:

Adding: AB1011_A1  |          | A1
Adding: AB1012_E2  |AB1012_G1 | E2
Adding: AB1012_G1  |          | G1
Adding: AB1013_C3  |          | C3
Adding: AB1014_B1  |          | B1
Adding: AB1015_F2  |AB1015_H1 | F2
Adding: AB1015_H1  |          | H1

answers.body:
You can use List.indexOf() to find the index of a duplicate value. However, since it always searches from the front of the list, you will have to use List.subList() to take a slice of the list starting after the value you're searching from. You can then use that index to determine what its full string will be:

for (int i = 0; i < fileContents.size(); i++) {
  String replicate = "         "; // placeholder 9 spaces for when a duplicate is not found

  int duplicateIndex = fileContents.subList(i + 1, fileContents.size()).indexOf(fileContents.get(i)) + i + 1;

  if (duplicateIndex != -1) {
    replicate = fileContents.get(duplicateIndex) + "_" + sample_letter[duplicateIndex];
  }

  String[] rowInfo = { fileContents.get(i) + "_" + sample_letter[i], replicate, sample_letter[i] };
  System.out.println("Adding: " + fileContents.get(i) + "_" + sample_letter[i] + "  | " + replicate + " | " + sample_letter[i]);
  rows.add(rowInfo);
}

question_comments.body: Ok, I will change it to `	if (fileContents.get(k).equals(fileContents.get(j))) {`
if (fileContents.get(k) == fileContents.get(j)) { Before we go any further, you can't compare Strings like that. You need String::equals

79611122.body: And also it might be worth mentioning that the duplicate value can be anywhere below the original one - not necessarily on the next line.
Contd.. Note: I want AB1012_G1 only next to AB1012_E2 since AB1012_E2 is present after AB1012_G1.

Thanks. It seems to be putting value for replicate even if there are no duplicates present. For example: Adding: AB1011_A1 | AB1011_A1 | A1. In this case there are no AB1011 duplicate present and hence I would like it to get printed like this :Adding: AB1011_A1 | | A1. Similarly for other non duplicates as well. Only, where duplicates are present, I want to get it printed like this - Adding: AB1012_E2 | AB1012_G1 | E2
my bad, forgot to account for the adjusted indexes in the sublist. Corrected my answer

Thanks. You code is generating Adding: AB1012_E2 | AB1011_A1 | E2. Whereas, I am looking for Adding: AB1012_E2 | AB1012_G1 | E2. Similarly for Adding: AB1015_F2 | AB1011_A1 | F2, I'm looking for Adding: AB1015_F2 | AB1015_H1 | F2
